title: Trump's new book Crippled America â the live read as it happened | US news | The Guardian
summary: the end is nigh . chapters 14 and 15
the end is here . chapters 16 and 17
chapter 10 . lucky to be an american .
chapter 9 . nice guys can finish first .

documents.title: the end is here . chapters 16 and 17
text: we 're almost there .
stay with me .
a tax code that works is the title of chapter 16 .
the current tax code is no good .
a trump tax plan would mean eliminating deduction and loopholes available for the very rich .
this actually sounds pretty good .
if you 're single and earning less than $ 25k , or married and earn less than $ 50k , you wo n't pay income tax .
according to trump this will remove nearly 75m households from the income tax rolls .
businesses are taxed unfairly , especially small businesses .
it wo n't do .
he was great , was n't he ?
walker/time & life pictures/getty image obligatory ronald reagan reference : under reagan america had the best corporate tax rate in the world .
now we 've got the worst .
sad face .
the last chapter .
it 's called making america great again after that hat presumably .
donald trump bought the commodore hotel many years ago .
it had once been great , he says .
i can sense where this is going .
he did the hotel up .
it became the grand hyatt .
he made it great again .
the challenges ahead are many .
alright yoda .
but guess what ?
i have a vision and i understand the process by which we 're going to accomplish our goals .
one of the things we need to do is reinvigorate the american dream .
washington dc is in gridlock .
we have three branches of government , trump says , but the trunk of the tree nice is rotting away .
a ( slightly labored ) metaphor for our government .
lo scalzo/epa trump summarizes his previous chapters .
jobs .
military .
immigration , obvs .
education .
healthcare .
there are some plugs for his golf courses and hotels .
people come from all over to play on his golf courses , although : i do n't just want to bring golfers to america .
we need to bring all kinds of businesses back to america .
we are at a critical turning point in our history .
but america 's best days are still to come .
why ?
because of our people .
together we can make america great again .
that 's it .
that 's the end .
together we made it through crippled america .
will it be a best seller ?
will it propel trump to the presidency ?
will it rival the bible as trump 's favourite book ?
only time will tell .
for now , it 's time to go home .
can someone bring me loads of booze please ?
thank you .
goodbye .

documents.title: the end is nigh . chapters 14 and 15
text: chapter 14 is called a new game in town .
i like it .
here are some quotes .
contrary to the jokes , i do n't think the white house needs any bright neon signs on the roof .
boo !
i continue to be what i have always been the greatest cheerleader for america .
woo !
a cheerleader .
toth/bpi/rex shutterstock america is the greatest country that has ever existed on earth , it turns out .
the national anthem got it right : this is the land of the free and the home of the brave .
making america great again means standing by our word .
so that 's what it means .
many of the lessons trump has learnt in business are applicable to our current situation .
this is beginning to sound like a ropey job interview .
making america great again means convincing the smartest and best people to come to washington and join in putting our country first , trump says .
what happened to it being about standing by our word ?
a scene from hit television show law and order .
/getty images turns out it also means restoring law and order and taking our country back from big money interests .
oh and making america great again begins at home , whatever that means .
on to chapter 15 : teaching the media dollars and sense .
i do n't know what that means either .
although it sounds like it could be the title of a trump university course .
( remember that ? )
trump lists some media organisations that were unfriendly to him when he launched his presidential campaign .
earlier in the book he had said sticks and stones might break his bones but names will never hurt him .
that 's been put to one side .
the media is sad and often pathetic .
has he been speaking to my dad ?
trump has built a lot of buildings .
he lists many of them .
got ta bump up that word count !
only two chapters left .

documents.title: we accelerate . chapters 11 - 13
text: come on , let 's get this over with .
chapter 11 is called the right to bear arms .
the second amendment is really important .
donald trump owns guns and donald trump has a concealed-carry permit .
donald trump thinks concealed-carry permits should be valid in every state .
a big gun .
we need to keep guns out of the hands of people with mental health issues , though .
however background checks are bad , trump says , so it 's unclear how he this would happen .
chapter 12 is titled our infrastructure is crumbling .
you heard .
this country 's infrastructure is falling apart .
quite literally .
in fact , our infrastructure is terrible and it 's only getting worse .
an aeroplane .
it must not have landed at laguardia yet .
that includes the airports , trump writes .
if you land at laguardia , it feels like the wheels of the aircraft have come off .
meanwhile : the chinese build new cities in about 12 minutes .
efficient .
over here it 's a different story .
it takes us years to get permits to add a dormer window to our homes .
chapter 13 has a pithy name : values .
the one question i get asked all the time is , mr trump , how do i get rich ? '
they always use the prefix because mr trump is important and also they want to sound like oliver twist asking for more gruel .
trump knows the richest people in the world .
they 're not always the happiest people though and some of their personal lives may leave something to be desired , he says .
this is a strangely dark reference .
there 's an unintentionally heartbreaking moment in this chapter when trump brags about being a cadet captain in high school .
he was one of the highest ranking cadets , he says .
maybe i need to start telling people about the time i was a milk monitor .

documents.title: chapter 10 . lucky to be an american
text: i know how lucky i am .
the day i was born i had already won the greatest lottery on earth , trump writes .
that 's because i was born to a father who was fantastically wealthy , he adds .
he does n't really .
it 's because he was born in the united states .
trump owns a big house in florida .
it is a nice house .
one time he raised a big flag outside the house .
local authorities said the big flag violated zoning regulations .
they started fining him .
trump sued them for $ 25m .
he did not get $ 25m .
the anecdote rather falls down here .
the american flag , seen here round the shoulders of rocky .
/ rex features by the way , the american flag is great is n't it ?
it represents courage and sacrifice .
ivanka trump , donald 's daughter went to czechoslovakia once .
at the time people there were proud to have american things .
they taped one dollar bills to their car windshields .
but now the czechs are laughing at us , apparently .
we learn that you rarely hear the phrase made in america anymore .
this is a shame .
you certainly do n't see it on donald trump 's ties because they are made in china .
but let 's ignore that .

documents.title: chapter 9 . nice guys can finish first
text: i 'm a nice guy .
i really am .
this is the opening sentence .
i 'm not afraid to say what i believe .
this is true .
we 've already heard trump 's beliefs on immigrants and climate change .
oh you know who really appreciates this approach ?
the american people , that 's who .
( donald trump is actually viewed negatively by a majority of the american people . )
when donald trump announced he was running he was interested to see which of his so-called friends would remain loyal to me .
he appears to have bad judgement in friends because quite a few of them did n't .
there follows a list of those who have wronged him .
terry lundgren of macy 's .
steve burke of comcast .
nbc 's president bob greenblatt .
paul telegdy , nbc 's head of reality television .
randy falco , univision .
beau ferrari of univision .
people attacked trump 's hair when he announced he was running for president .
it is his own hair .
trump has n't put out specifics for his presidency because there are a lot of different voices that need to be heard when deciding things .
just take his word for it , it 'll be fine .
fred trump , donald 's father , loaned him a small loan amount of money when he wanted to build property in manhattan .
it was only $ 1m .
the tight git .
a baby .
images / alamy/alamy more about anchor babies .
coming over here , drinking our milk .
they need to go .
second amendment good .
tax system broken .
iran bad .

documents.title: chapter 8 . it 's still the economy , stupid
text: i 'm rich .
i mean , i 'm really rich .
this information is presented with little-to-no context .
when trump listens to some of his gop competitors he shakes his head .
i think : you would n't have even qualified to be a contestant on the apprentice . '
i believe this is meant as an insult .
president obama loves playing golf but by gosh he plays with the wrong people .
he should be playing with smart people who can help our country , not his loser friends .
trump , meanwhile , knows how to work a golf course .
president barack obama , playing golf with the wrong people .
samad/afp/getty images during the 1990 recession a lot of trump 's friends went bankrupt .
he never went bankrupt , he says .
apart from those four corporate bankruptcies but oops we wo n't mention those here .
there is crazy over-regulation by the government .
you can barely buy a paper clip without being in violation of some governmental policy .
system is broken .
national debt .
whatever happened to american dreams ?
trump would not cut social security or medicare .
trump employs thousands of people .
we have to bring jobs back from places like china , japan , and mexico .
again : trump employs thousands of people .
trump knows how to fix the economy .
it is quite simple .
all it takes is a commitment to winning and making made in america a badge of honor just like it used to be .

documents.title: chapter 7 . health care is making us all sick
text: donald trump has hired thousands of employees .
we know this because he repeats it over and over again in this chapter .
plus : health care is rubbish .
trump is lucky because he can afford the best health care in the world .
but he knows that others ca n't .
obamacare is a catastrophe .
he calls it the un-affordable care act , which is cute .
yes , trump once said he believed in a single-payer system but that plan would have been way better than the un-affordable care act .
and anyway , he was a non politician at the time .
and it was a different time .
it would n't work now .
the solution to sorting out the un-affordable care act is to hire the most knowledgeable people in the world and lock them in a room .
like big brother except they ca n't leave until everything is fixed or they eat each other .
nobody understands business better than trump , obviously , so he can sort this mess out .
we 'll do it by telling the federal government to eff off and allowing insurance companies to compete for your business .
there might be a problem with this because insurance companies are currently ripping us all off and making a fortune .
but this contradiction is not addressed .
in conclusion : if we follow my logic , our healthcare system , and our economy , will be well again very soon .

documents.title: chapter 6 . the energy debate : a lot of hot air
text: climate change does not exist .
or if it does it is not man made .
no evidence is given for this , but it is fact .
there is oil in america and natural gas and we should use that .
it will last us until next century and by then we 'll all be dead anyway .
the keystone xl pipeline should be allowed to go ahead .
we should drill everywhere oil is accessible .
windpower : rubbish .
windpower is the worst .
it ruins the view from golf courses .
that 's about it .

documents.title: chapter 5 . education : a failing grade
text: the department of education needs to be gotten rid of .
donald trump went to a military school , which was a tough , tough place .
he learned how to neatly fold his clothing so it could be stacked .
this is not a skill that has had much application in my life .
but it taught discipline .
he was taught not to lie , cheat or steal , or tolerate those who do .
this may be why i never became a politician , he quips .
by the way do you know what makes a kid feel good ?
winning .
meanwhile , in many schools grading has been eliminated entirely .
someone should factcheck this .
i 'd do it but i 've got my nose in a really good book .
teacher unions : bad .
schools competing for children ?
good .
teachers are n't paid enough .
we need greater discipline , although we should not go back to the days when teachers would get physical with students .
college tuition is too much and loans suck .
we should do something about it but , from this book at least , it is not clear what .

documents.title: chapter 4 . foreign policy : fighting for peace
text: some people say donald trump has no experience in foreign policy .
they 're right , he does n't , but it does n't matter because he would expand the military and that would sort everything out .
teddy roosevelt believed america should speak softly and carry a big stick .
a big stick .
nylind for the guardian and mike tyson , the famous fighter , once explained his philosophy , saying , everybody has a plan until they get punched in the mouth . '
mike tyson is famous for something else that trump has spoken about a lot in this book , but we wo n't dwell on that .
building up the military is buying peace .
it is also smart business because people have to build all those planes and ships .
the us is defending germany , japan and south korea , but we 're not being paid a dime for it .
it is time the rest of the world paid their fair share , and if i have anything to say about it , they will !
go team mercenaries !
the entire isis force probably would n't even fill yankee stadium .
obama 's iran deal totally sucked .
china is the biggest problem though .
they destroyed our industries .
although they are very savvy businesspeople .
in fact , trump has had several of his trump-brand products made there .
our politicians are too stupid or too foolish , or both , to understand that we need to be tough with china .
carl icahn understands it , and if he were representing america things would be better .

in conclusion : we should stand up to china , whatever that means , and we need to start sending a bill to the saudi arabians , the south koreans , the germans , the japanese and the british for the costs of the us military .
we 're protecting them , after all .

documents.title: chapter 3 . immigration : good walls make good neighbours
text: we hear more about this big wall that mexico is going to pay for .
oh and guess what ?
illegal immigration is killing this country .
do n't get him wrong , donald trump loves immigration .
( i can close my eyes and imagine what my relatives must have been thinking when they sailed past the statue of liberty into new york . )
what he does not like is illegal immigration .
there 's more about this : floods of illegal immigrants , dangerous problems , borders , immigrants as a source of crime .
he has tremendous respect for mexico , he says , which will come as a surprise to the people of mexico .
and to the mexican government : which has , according to trump 's pen , published pamphlets explaining how to illegally emigrate to the united states .
some of the illegal immigrants are rapists , we hear .
again .
luckily , nobody can build a wall like me .
the wall will save us from these crusading immigrants , he says .
we really need a wall .
china built a big wall and that was ages ago .
the israelis have a wall and that has been a great success that has n't caused any problems whatsoever .
there 's more on the wall ( is he campaigning for a job at home depot ?
) : it will have a big , beautiful door , just like mordor has in the lord of the rings .
but this one will be keeping out immigrants , not orcs , although maybe they 're the same thing .
wall wall wall .
we need to triple the number of immigration officers we have until the wall is built .
we need to enforce visa regulations so people ca n't stay here after they expire .
we need to stop birthright citizenship , or anchor babies .
kick them out .
while those anchor babies can bugger off back to where they came from the womb , i guess the us should allow foreigners to stay if they have master 's degrees and are smart , he says .
adam gabbatt ( @ adamgabbatt ) crippled i tell you

documents.title: interlude
text: i 've just nipped up the road to trump tower to witness donald giving a press conference about his book .
it is a good book , he says .
we did this quickly and we think we did it effectively .
it 's been a great experience .
america is crippled , according to trump .
there were about seven or eight trump staffers applauding off to the side when the business mogul/author stepped up to his podium .
and about 50 members of the public standing up above , taking photos from the ballustrades .
trump says there are a lot of people lining up outside to have their books signed .
( i 'd say there were about 100 . )
some have been in line now for 12-14 hours !
he says .
this may or may not be true .
i ask trump why he does n't believe in climate change .
he writes this in crippled america but does n't explain it .
he does n't explain it here either .
ok , what else , he says , and turns briskly to another journalist .
oh well .

documents.title: chapter 2 . our 'unbiased ' political media
text: megyn kelly , of the famously republican-hating fox news , takes a blasting right from the off .
she was clearly out to get me at the first gop debate , trump whines .
it 's interesting he should bring up kelly because surely it will remind a lot of people about when he said she was being mean to him because she was on her period .
moving on : donald trump does n't wait to hear what a pollster has to say because he does n't use pollsters .
this is almost as rich as donald trump claims he is .
his main campaign strategy has been telling people how well he is doing in the polls .
money .
donald trump has a lot of it .
/getty images/stockdisc what else ?
oh , trump does n't speak from a script because he is a very successful businessman .
megyn kelly is mentioned again .
we lose to china , mexico , russia and iran , he says .
trump learned a long time ago that if you say outrageous things the media love you .
despite that he says the media are abusive to him .
some journalists are horrible human beings , they are dishonest .
i know a lot of journalists and this is true enough .
there 's more about his golf courses .
oh and about nbc giving him the apprentice gig .
that ended well .
i like this bit a lot : i have a wonderful and beautiful wife .
i 've got billions of dollars .
wife .
donald trump has one , and she is beautiful .
glikas/filmmagic because of this , he says , criticism does n't bother him , and it ca n't hurt him .
i guess that 's why he has devoted chapter 2 of crippled america to criticism of him .
there 's a reference to his campaign launch .
you know , the one where he said mexico was sending drug dealers and rapists to the us .
it turns out the media misquoted him .
what he said was that among all the illegal immigrants coming from mexico were some pretty bad people , some of them are rapists , some of them are drug dealers .
this is not what he said .
what he said was : they [ mexico ] are sending us not the right people .
the us has become a dumping ground for everyone else 's problems .
they 're sending people that have lots of problems and they 're bringing their problems .
they 're bringing drugs , they 're bringing crime , they 're rapists , and some i assume are good people but i speak to border guards and they tell us what we are getting .
but , you know .
hispanics love him , as it turns out .
but that 's not what the media reported .
he recalls being asked in an interview whether he knew the names of the world 's most prominent terrorists .
( he did n't . )
it was a ridiculous question he says .
after all : we 're not playing trivial pursuit .
more on trump 's golf courses .
megyn kelly is mentioned again .
and despite that stuff earlier on about the media loving him because of those outrageous comments , it turns out they actually hate trump : because they know i do n't need them .

documents.title: chapter 1 . winning again
text: the chapter title brings to mind something charlie sheen might tweet beneath a of him with an arm round a playboy model .
good start .
we have a president who tries to get tough but is n't .
we make concessions to other countries .
that 's not winning !
if i ran my business that way , i 'd fire myself , trump says , which hardly sounds like a good way to run a business .
there 's some stuff about iran .
the iranians ca n't be trusted .
we need a government that is committed to winning and has experience in winning , you see .
the word winning appears six times in this chapter .
real extract : donald trump builds businesses .
donald trump builds buildings .
donald trump develops magnificent golf courses .
donald trump makes investments that create jobs .
and donald trump creates jobs for legal immigrants and all americans .

documents.title: preface
text: there are 169 pages in crippled america .
it takes one page before donald trump raises the subject of illegal immigrants .
they are among a list of the relentless and incompetent naysayers of the status quo that trump says knew would line up against him .
the others include : members of the media ( no concept of the difference between fact ' and opinion ' ) .
congress ( deadlocked for years ) .
politicians ( play like total losers when they actually try to govern ) .
trump reminds us , unnecessarily , that he has promised to build a major wall that would be very high .
he then admits to being surprised by the reaction the positive reaction to his campaign .
i know i 'm a great builder , he says what is this , architecture weekly ?
but i had n't fully exposed my political thoughts and ideas to restore america 's greatness .
true dat .
a builder .

/bloomberg via getty images he also says , in a tone reminiscent of a famous uk ferrero rocher advert , that he knew that the trump brand is one of the world 's great icons of quality and excellence .
as trump rose in the gop polls , the media , the politicians , and the so-called leaders of our country reacted in horror , he says , which is accurate enough .
towards the end of the preface trump set out his vision for america : we need to outline commonsense policies and then knock some heads together if necessary to make them work .
amen brother
donald trump 's latest book crippled america : how to make america great again is released today .
it sets out trump 's vision for america , as well as giving us more information about his past .
the revelations include that his father , fred trump , gave him a small loan of $ 1m when trump wanted to invest in manhattan .
the book also expands further trump 's views on immigrants beyond his opinion that mexico is sending rapists and drug dealers to america .
mexico , according to trump , has also published pamphlets explaining how to illegally emigrate to the united states .
trump will be signing copies of the book in new york city later on , and i will be reporting from the event .
i will also be live-reading crippled america .
so you do n't have to .
follow it here .

bulletin.text: Adam Gabbatt is reading the Republican presidential candidate's new book so you don't have to.
